pullRequest.body:
leanprover/lean4#6024 fixes a serious elaboration bug which, perversely, was quite helpful.

Kyle is investigating replacing the bug with something intentional, but we definitively need to fix the bug in the meantime.

This is the backport of changes from lean-pr-testing-6024 which do not have conflicts with `master`. There are a few more changes that we'll need to handle separately later.

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Good point @kbuzzard, I'll adjust the adaptation notes.

Regarding the workflow, with this PR we're just trying to modify Mathlib to avoid making use of an existing bug. It's not necessary to do this, but it's a way we can make the adaptation PRs less massive down the line. It can also make fixing `nightly-testing` easier once lean4#6024 is merged.

This is all fine. Re the new adaptation notes: I don't really understand enough about why they are there to comment, but I was surprised that they just all mentioned a date 11-11-2024 rather than the Lean issue https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/6024 which was the cause of the adaptation. 

I also note that the Lean PR is not yet merged. I'm just flagging this because I don't really understand the workflow.

This is all fine. Re the new adaptation notes: I don't really understand enough about why they are there to comment, but I was surprised that they just all mentioned a date 11-11-2024 rather than the Lean issue https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/6024 which was the cause of the adaptation. 

I also note that the Lean PR is not yet merged. I'm just flagging this because I don't really understand the workflow.

```suggestion
    exact ‚ü®t, hts'.trans hs'.subset, htI‚ü©
```
completely optional

Out of curiosity, what's happening here? Most of the changes in this PR are making things more explicit - which is what I expected given the change in lean4#6024, but here it's becoming less explicit!

It turns out this one was failing because the coercion created a metavariable that stopped the propagation of any information. The solutions were to either (1) figure out what the actual expected type was supposed to be (often this was hard to write down for various reasons!) or (2) erase the expression since it was determined by the other arguments anyway.

I'm really hoping that we'll have a more principled way to propagate type information across coercions. This fix is a necessary regression for now.

pullRequest.title: chore: backports of adaptations for leanprover/lean4#6024
